item.title: Building a culture of pioneering responsibly | DeepMind Blog
item.description: When I joined DeepMind as COO, I did so in large part because I could tell that the founders and team had the same focus on positive social impact. In fact, at DeepMind, we now champion a term that pe...
item.content:encoded: When I joined DeepMind as COO, I did so in large part because I could tell that the founders and team had the same focus on positive social impact. In fact, at DeepMind, we now champion a term that perfectly captures my own values and hopes for integrating technology into people‚Äôs daily lives: pioneering responsibly. I believe pioneering responsibly should be a priority for anyone working in tech. But I also recognise that it‚Äôs especially important when it comes to powerful, widespread technolog...

item.description: In October 2021, we announced that we acquired the MuJoCo physics simulator, and made it freely available for everyone to support research everywhere. We also committed to developing and maintaining M...
item.content:encoded: In October 2021, we announced that we acquired the MuJoCo physics simulator, and made it freely available for everyone to support research everywhere. We also committed to developing and maintaining MuJoCo as a free, open-source, community-driven project with best-in-class capabilities. Today, we‚Äôre thrilled to report that open sourcing is complete and the entire codebase is on GitHub! Here, we explain why MuJoCo is a great platform for open-source collaboration and share a preview of our roadma...

item.content:encoded: If you want to be at DeepMind, go for it. Apply, interview, and just try. You might not get it the first time but that doesn‚Äôt mean you can‚Äôt try again. I never thought DeepMind would accept me, and when they did, I thought it was a mistake. Everyone doubts themselves ‚Äì I‚Äôve never felt like the smartest person in the room. I‚Äôve often felt the opposite. But I‚Äôve learned that, despite those feelings, I do belong and I do deserve to work at a place like this. And that journey, for me, started with ...

item.content:encoded: Posted by Jiahui Yu, Senior Research Scientist, and Jing Yu Koh, Research Software Engineer, Google Research In recent years, natural language processing models have dramatically improved their ability to learn general-purpose representations, which has resulted in significant performance gains for a wide range of natural language generation and natural language understanding tasks. In large part, this has been accomplished through pre-training language models on extensive unlabeled text corpora...

item.content:encoded: Posted by Aurelien Boffy, Senior Staff Software Engineer, and Roberto Pieraccini, Engineering Director, Google Assistant When people converse with one another, context and references play a critical role in driving their conversation more efficiently. For instance, if one asks the question ‚ÄúWho wrote Romeo and Juliet?‚Äù and, after receiving an answer, asks ‚ÄúWhere was he born?‚Äù, it is clear that ‚Äòhe‚Äô is referring to William Shakespeare without the need to explicitly mention him. item.title: Language Models Perform Reasoning via Chain of Thought | Google AI Blog
item.description: Posted by Jason Wei and Denny Zhou, Research Scientists, Google Research, Brain team In recent years, scaling up the size of language models has been shown to be a reliable way to improve performance ...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Jason Wei and Denny Zhou, Research Scientists, Google Research, Brain team In recent years, scaling up the size of language models has been shown to be a reliable way to improve performance on a range of natural language processing (NLP) tasks. Today‚Äôs language models at the scale of 100B or more parameters achieve strong performance on tasks like sentiment analysis and machine translation, even with little or no training examples. Even the largest language models, however, can still s...

item.title: Unlocking Zero-Resource Machine Translation to Support New Languages in Google Translate | Google AI Blog
item.description: Posted by Isaac Caswell and Ankur Bapna, Research Scientists, Google Translate Machine translation (MT) technology has made significant advances in recent years, as deep learning has been integrated w...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Isaac Caswell and Ankur Bapna, Research Scientists, Google Translate Machine translation (MT) technology has made significant advances in recent years, as deep learning has been integrated with natural language processing (NLP). Performance on research benchmarks like WMT have soared, and translation services have improved in quality and expanded to include new languages. Nevertheless, while existing translation services cover languages spoken by the majority of people world wide, they...
